text: Robert Lee Griffin III (born February 12, 1990), nicknamed RG3, is an American football quarterback for the Baltimore Ravens of the National Football League (NFL). He played college football for Baylor University, and won the 2011 Heisman Trophy for being the best college player that year. He was the second person taken by the Washington Redskins with the second pick of the 2012 NFL Draft. Later in 2016 he was traded to the Cleveland Browns. He spent three years backing up Lamar Jackson for the Baltimore Ravens. Currently he is employed by ESPN covering NCAA and NFL games. ==References== Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:African-American players of American football Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Sportspeople from Texas Category:Washington Redskins players Category:Heisman Trophy winners
title: Robert Griffin III
